com.facebook.buck.rules

Class InputRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.rules.InputRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BuildRule, Comparable<BuildRule>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FakeInputRule

    public class InputRule
extends Object
implements BuildRule
    InputRule is a no-op BuildRule that encapsulates an input file. This encapsulation allows the entire dependency graph to deal with BuildRules, rather than having leaves of a different type.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.facebook.buck.rules.BuildRule

        VISIBILITY_PUBLIC

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected InputRule(File inputFile, String relativePath)
      It is imperative that inputFile be properly relativized, so use inputPathAsInputRule(String, Function) to create an InputRule.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputRule

        protected InputRule(File inputFile,
         String relativePath)
        It is imperative that inputFile be properly relativized, so use inputPathAsInputRule(String, Function) to create an InputRule. The only reason this method is protected rather than private is so that fakes can be created for testing.

      • isPackagingRule

        public boolean isPackagingRule()
        Specified by:
        isPackagingRule in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        whether or not this rule is considered a packaging rule. Packaging rules (like java_binary) are rules that package up all of their transitive dependencies in their final output.

      • getPathToOutputFile

        public String getPathToOutputFile()
        Specified by:
        getPathToOutputFile in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        the relative path to the primary output of the build rule. If non-null, this path must identify a single file (as opposed to a directory).

      • getOutputKey

        public OutputKey getOutputKey(ProjectFilesystem projectFilesystem)
        Description copied from interface: BuildRule
        If the BuildRule has an output (as reported by getOutput()), return the OutputKey associated with the file returned by getOutput(); return a non-idempotent OutputKey otherwise.
        Specified by:
        getOutputKey in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        key based on the BuildRule's output contents if getOutput() returns non-null; a nonIdempotent OutputKey otherwise. A missing/unreadable output file results in a non-idempotent OutputKey.

      • getRuleKey

        public RuleKey getRuleKey()
        Description copied from interface: BuildRule
        If the resulting RuleKey is non-idempotent, it must not be internally memoized -- subsequent calls to getRuleKey() must re-evaluate the BuildRule's transitive state. Under normal operating conditions non-idempotent RuleKeys may arise due to not-yet-generated outputs. With careful ordering of execution planning versus RuleKey generation it is usually possible to avoid the creation of non-idempotent RuleKeys. However, dependency graph construction/evaluation would need to be incremental in order to reliably maintain an invariant which would allow blind RuleKey memoization.
        Specified by:
        getRuleKey in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        key based on the BuildRule's state, including the transitive closure of its dependencies' keys.
